page.title: 09Transport in N/Ham/Coll P
page.content: The North Hammersmith and College Park area is quite rich in transport. It has railway line to other parts of the country. This stops at Willesden Junction and Acton Central.It also has an underground train line(the central) which stops at East Acton, White City and Shepherds Bush, to take people into the centre of London, and to the east part of London. Most of the bus routes go to the centre of London and Hammersmith. The roads are extremely busy and some are dangerous to cross. There is a large dual-carriageway road which runs from central London to outside London in the west suburbs. Many of the people work at the local railway depot at Willesden Junction, which is the starting point for trains travelling to Euston. The industry in the area surrounds the railway.
